info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 1:41PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 141 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles south of Segundo, or 22 miles west of Raton. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Colfax County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
